195#define RETURN_FAILURE_IF_EXCEPTION(isolate) \
196 do { \
197 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
198 if (__isolate__->has_exception()) { \
199 return ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception(); \
200 } \
201 } while (false)
202
203#define RETURN_FAILURE_IF_EXCEPTION_DETECTOR(isolate, detector) \
204 do { \
205 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
206 if (__isolate__->has_exception()) { \
207 detector.AcceptSideEffects(); \
208 return ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception(); \
209 } \
210 } while (false)
211
212// Macros for MaybeHandle.
213
214#define RETURN_VALUE_IF_EXCEPTION(isolate, value) \
215 do { \
216 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
217 if (__isolate__->has_exception()) { \
218 return value; \
219 } \
220 } while (false)
221
222#define RETURN_VALUE_IF_EXCEPTION_DETECTOR(isolate, detector, value) \
223 RETURN_VALUE_IF_EXCEPTION(isolate, (detector.AcceptSideEffects(), value))
224
225#define RETURN_EXCEPTION_IF_EXCEPTION(isolate, T) \
226 RETURN_VALUE_IF_EXCEPTION(isolate, MaybeHandle<T>())
227
228#define MAYBE_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, call, value) \
229 do { \
230 if ((call).IsNothing()) { \
231 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
232 return value; \
233 } \
234 } while (false)
235
254#define RETURN_RESULT_OR_FAILURE(isolate, call) \
255 do { \
256 DirectHandle<Object> __result__; \
257 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
258 if (!(call).ToHandle(&__result__)) { \
259 DCHECK(__isolate__->has_exception()); \
260 return ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception(); \
261 } \
262 DCHECK(!__isolate__->has_exception()); \
263 return *__result__; \
264 } while (false)
265
266#define ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, dst, call, value) \
267 do { \
268 if (!(call).ToHandle(&dst)) { \
269 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
270 return value; \
271 } \
272 } while (false)
273
274#define ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, dst, call) \
275 do { \
276 auto* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
277 ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(__isolate__, dst, call, \
278 ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception()); \
279 } while (false)
280
281#define ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, dst, call, T) \
282 ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, dst, call, MaybeHandle<T>())
283
284#define THROW_NEW_ERROR(isolate, call, T) \
285 do { \
286 auto* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
287 return __isolate__->template Throw<T>(__isolate__->factory()->call); \
288 } while (false)
289
290#define THROW_NEW_ERROR_RETURN_FAILURE(isolate, call) \
291 do { \
292 auto* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
293 return __isolate__->Throw(*__isolate__->factory()->call); \
294 } while (false)
295
296#define THROW_NEW_ERROR_RETURN_VALUE(isolate, call, value) \
297 do { \
298 auto* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
299 __isolate__->Throw(*__isolate__->factory()->call); \
300 return value; \
301 } while (false)
302
333#define RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, call, value) \
334 do { \
335 if ((call).is_null()) { \
336 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
337 return value; \
338 } \
339 } while (false)
340
361#define RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, call) \
362 do { \
363 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
364 RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(__isolate__, call, \
365 ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception()); \
366 } while (false);
367
388#define RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, call, T) \
389 RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, call, MaybeHandle<T>())
390
391#define RETURN_FAILURE(isolate, should_throw, call) \
392 do { \
393 if ((should_throw) == kDontThrow) { \
394 return Just(false); \
395 } else { \
396 isolate->Throw(*isolate->factory()->call); \
397 return Nothing<bool>(); \
398 } \
399 } while (false)
400
401#define MAYBE_RETURN(call, value) \
402 do { \
403 if ((call).IsNothing()) return value; \
404 } while (false)
405
406#define MAYBE_RETURN_NULL(call) MAYBE_RETURN(call, MaybeHandle<Object>())
407
408#define API_ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, dst, call, value) \
409 do { \
410 if (!(call).ToLocal(&dst)) { \
411 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
412 return value; \
413 } \
414 } while (false)
415
416#define MAYBE_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, call, value) \
417 do { \
418 if ((call).IsNothing()) { \
419 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
420 return value; \
421 } \
422 } while (false)
423
424#define MAYBE_ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, dst, call, value) \
425 do { \
426 if (!(call).To(&dst)) { \
427 DCHECK((isolate)->has_exception()); \
428 return value; \
429 } \
430 } while (false)
431
432#define MAYBE_ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(isolate, dst, call) \
433 do { \
434 Isolate* __isolate__ = (isolate); \
435 if (!(call).To(&dst)) { \
436 DCHECK(__isolate__->has_exception()); \
437 return ReadOnlyRoots(__isolate__).exception(); \
438 } \
439 } while (false)
440
441#define FOR_WITH_HANDLE_SCOPE(isolate, loop_var_type, init, loop_var, \
442 limit_check, increment, body) \
443 do { \
444 loop_var_type init; \
445 loop_var_type for_with_handle_limit = loop_var; \
446 Isolate* for_with_handle_isolate = isolate; \
447 while (limit_check) { \
448 for_with_handle_limit += 1024; \
449 HandleScope loop_scope(for_with_handle_isolate); \
450 for (; limit_check && loop_var < for_with_handle_limit; increment) { \
451 body \
452 } \
453 } \
454 } while (false)
455
456#define WHILE_WITH_HANDLE_SCOPE(isolate, limit_check, body) \
457 do { \
458 Isolate* for_with_handle_isolate = isolate; \
459 while (limit_check) { \
460 HandleScope loop_scope(for_with_handle_isolate); \
461 for (int for_with_handle_it = 0; \
462 limit_check && for_with_handle_it < 1024; ++for_with_handle_it) { \
463 body \
464 } \
465 } \
466 } while (false)
467
468#define FIELD_ACCESSOR(type, name) \
469 inline void set_##name(type v) { name##_ = v; } \
470 inline type name() const { return name##_; }
471

556#define THREAD_LOCAL_TOP_ACCESSOR(type, name) \
557 inline void set_##name(type v) { thread_local_top()->name##_ = v; } \
558 inline type name() const { return thread_local_top()->name##_; }
559
560#define THREAD_LOCAL_TOP_ADDRESS(type, name) \
561 inline type* name##_address() { return &thread_local_top()->name##_; }
562
563// HiddenFactory exists so Isolate can privately inherit from it without making
564// Factory's members available to Isolate directly.
565class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE HiddenFactory : private Factory {};
566
567class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Isolate final : private HiddenFactory {
568 // These forward declarations are required to make the friend declarations in
569 // PerIsolateThreadData work on some older versions of gcc.
570 class ThreadDataTable;
571 class EntryStackItem;
572
573 public:
574 Isolate(const Isolate&) = delete;
575 Isolate& operator=(const Isolate&) = delete;
576
577 using HandleScopeType = HandleScope;
578 void* operator new(size_t) = delete;
579 void operator delete(void*) = delete;
580
581 // A thread has a PerIsolateThreadData instance for each isolate that it has
582 // entered. That instance is allocated when the isolate is initially entered
583 // and reused on subsequent entries.
584 class PerIsolateThreadData {
585 public:
586 PerIsolateThreadData(Isolate* isolate, ThreadId thread_id)
587 : isolate_(isolate),
588 thread_id_(thread_id),
589 stack_limit_(0),
590 thread_state_(nullptr)
591#if USE_SIMULATOR
592 ,
593 simulator_(nullptr)
594#endif
595 {
596 }
597 ~PerIsolateThreadData();
598 PerIsolateThreadData(const PerIsolateThreadData&) = delete;
599 PerIsolateThreadData& operator=(const PerIsolateThreadData&) = delete;
600 Isolate* isolate() const { return isolate_; }
601 ThreadId thread_id() const { return thread_id_; }
602
603 FIELD_ACCESSOR(uintptr_t, stack_limit)
604 FIELD_ACCESSOR(ThreadState*, thread_state)
605#if USE_SIMULATOR
606 FIELD_ACCESSOR(Simulator*, simulator)
607#endif
608
609 bool Matches(Isolate* isolate, ThreadId thread_id) const {
610 return isolate_ == isolate && thread_id_ == thread_id;
611 }
612
613 private:
614 Isolate* isolate_;
615 ThreadId thread_id_;
616 uintptr_t stack_limit_;
617 ThreadState* thread_state_;
618
619#if USE_SIMULATOR
620 Simulator* simulator_;
621#endif
622
623 friend class Isolate;
624 friend class ThreadDataTable;
625 friend class EntryStackItem;
626 };
627
628 // Used for walking the promise tree for catch prediction.
629 struct PromiseHandler {
630 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> function_info;
631 bool async;
632 };
633
634 static void InitializeOncePerProcess();
635
636 // Creates Isolate object. Must be used instead of constructing Isolate with
637 // new operator.
638 static Isolate* New();
639
640 // Deletes Isolate object. Must be used instead of delete operator.
641 // Destroys the non-default isolates.
642 // Sets default isolate into "has_been_disposed" state rather then destroying,
643 // for legacy API reasons.
644 static void Delete(Isolate* isolate);
645
646 void SetUpFromReadOnlyArtifacts(std::shared_ptr<ReadOnlyArtifacts> artifacts,
647 ReadOnlyHeap* ro_heap);
648 void set_read_only_heap(ReadOnlyHeap* ro_heap) { read_only_heap_ = ro_heap; }
649
650 // Page allocator that must be used for allocating V8 heap pages.
651 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator() const;
652
653 // Returns the PerIsolateThreadData for the current thread (or nullptr if one
654 // is not currently set).
655 V8_INLINE static PerIsolateThreadData* CurrentPerIsolateThreadData();
656
657 // Returns the isolate inside which the current thread is running or nullptr.
658 V8_INLINE static Isolate* TryGetCurrent();
659
660 // Returns the isolate inside which the current thread is running.
661 V8_INLINE static Isolate* Current();
662
663 inline bool IsCurrent() const;
664
665 // Usually called by Init(), but can be called early e.g. to allow
666 // testing components that require logging but not the whole
667 // isolate.
668 //
669 // Safe to call more than once.
670 void InitializeLoggingAndCounters();
671 bool InitializeCounters(); // Returns false if already initialized.
672
673 bool InitWithoutSnapshot();
674 bool InitWithSnapshot(SnapshotData* startup_snapshot_data,
675 SnapshotData* read_only_snapshot_data,
676 SnapshotData* shared_heap_snapshot_data,
677 bool can_rehash);
678
679 // True if at least one thread Enter'ed this isolate.
680 bool IsInUse() { return entry_stack_ != nullptr; }
681
682 void ReleaseSharedPtrs();
683
684 void ClearSerializerData();
685
686 void UpdateLogObjectRelocation();
687
688 // Initializes the current thread to run this Isolate.
689 // Not thread-safe. Multiple threads should not Enter/Exit the same isolate
690 // at the same time, this should be prevented using external locking.
691 void Enter();
692
693 // Exits the current thread. The previously entered Isolate is restored
694 // for the thread.
695 // Not thread-safe. Multiple threads should not Enter/Exit the same isolate
696 // at the same time, this should be prevented using external locking.
697 void Exit();
698
699 // Find the PerThread for this particular (isolate, thread) combination.
700 // If one does not yet exist, allocate a new one.
701 PerIsolateThreadData* FindOrAllocatePerThreadDataForThisThread();
702
703 // Find the PerThread for this particular (isolate, thread) combination
704 // If one does not yet exist, return null.
705 PerIsolateThreadData* FindPerThreadDataForThisThread();
706
707 // Find the PerThread for given (isolate, thread) combination
708 // If one does not yet exist, return null.
709 PerIsolateThreadData* FindPerThreadDataForThread(ThreadId thread_id);
710
711 // Discard the PerThread for this particular (isolate, thread) combination
712 // If one does not yet exist, no-op.
713 void DiscardPerThreadDataForThisThread();
714
715 // Mutex for serializing access to break control structures.
716 base::RecursiveMutex* break_access() { return &break_access_; }
717
718 // Shared mutex for allowing thread-safe concurrent reads of FeedbackVectors.
719 base::SharedMutex* feedback_vector_access() {
720 return &feedback_vector_access_;
721 }
722
723 // Shared mutex for allowing thread-safe concurrent reads of
724 // InternalizedStrings.
725 base::SharedMutex* internalized_string_access() {
726 return &internalized_string_access_;
727 }
728
729 // Shared mutex for allowing thread-safe concurrent reads of TransitionArrays
730 // of kind kFullTransitionArray.
731 base::SharedMutex* full_transition_array_access() {
732 return &full_transition_array_access_;
733 }
734
735 // Shared mutex for allowing thread-safe concurrent reads of
736 // SharedFunctionInfos.
737 base::SharedMutex* shared_function_info_access() {
738 return &shared_function_info_access_;
739 }
740
741 // Protects (most) map update operations, see also MapUpdater.
742 base::SharedMutex* map_updater_access() { return &map_updater_access_; }
743
744 // Protects JSObject boilerplate migrations (i.e. calls to MigrateInstance on
745 // boilerplate objects; elements kind transitions are *not* protected).
746 // Note this lock interacts with `map_updater_access` as follows
747 //
748 // - boilerplate migrations may trigger map updates.
749 // - if so, `boilerplate_migration_access` is locked before
750 // `map_updater_access`.
751 // - backgrounds threads must use the same lock order to avoid deadlocks.
752 base::SharedMutex* boilerplate_migration_access() {
753 return &boilerplate_migration_access_;
754 }
755
756 ReadOnlyArtifacts* read_only_artifacts() const {
757 ReadOnlyArtifacts* artifacts = artifacts_.get();
758 DCHECK_IMPLIES(ReadOnlyHeap::IsReadOnlySpaceShared(), artifacts != nullptr);
759 return artifacts;
760 }
761
762 // The isolate's string table.
763 StringTable* string_table() const {
764 return OwnsStringTables() ? string_table_.get()
765 : shared_space_isolate()->string_table_.get();
766 }
767 StringForwardingTable* string_forwarding_table() const {
768 return OwnsStringTables()
769 ? string_forwarding_table_.get()
770 : shared_space_isolate()->string_forwarding_table_.get();
771 }
772
773 SharedStructTypeRegistry* shared_struct_type_registry() const {
774 return is_shared_space_isolate()
775 ? shared_struct_type_registry_.get()
776 : shared_space_isolate()->shared_struct_type_registry_.get();
777 }

779 Address get_address_from_id(IsolateAddressId id);
780
781 // Access to top context (where the current function object was created).
782 Tagged<Context> context() const { return thread_local_top()->context_; }
783 inline void set_context(Tagged<Context> context);
784 Tagged<Context>* context_address() { return &thread_local_top()->context_; }
785
786 // The "topmost script-having execution context" from the Web IDL spec
787 // (i.e. the context of the topmost user JavaScript code, see
788 // https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#topmost-script-having-execution-context)
789 // if known or Context::kNoContext otherwise.
790 Tagged<Context> topmost_script_having_context() const {
791 return thread_local_top()->topmost_script_having_context_;
792 }
793 inline void set_topmost_script_having_context(Tagged<Context> context);
794 inline void clear_topmost_script_having_context();
795 Tagged<Context>* topmost_script_having_context_address() {
796 return &thread_local_top()->topmost_script_having_context_;
797 }

799 // Access to current thread id.
800 inline void set_thread_id(ThreadId id) {
801 thread_local_top()->thread_id_.store(id, std::memory_order_relaxed);
802 }
803 inline ThreadId thread_id() const {
804 return thread_local_top()->thread_id_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
805 }

880 static uint32_t c_entry_fp_offset() {
881 return static_cast<uint32_t>(OFFSET_OF(Isolate, isolate_data_) +
882 OFFSET_OF(IsolateData, thread_local_top_) +
883 OFFSET_OF(ThreadLocalTop, c_entry_fp_) -
884 isolate_root_bias());
885 }

891#if defined(DEBUG) || defined(VERIFY_HEAP)
892 // Count the number of active deserializers, so that the heap verifier knows
893 // whether there is currently an active deserialization happening.
894 //
895 // This is needed as the verifier currently doesn't support verifying objects
896 // which are partially deserialized.
897 //
898 // TODO(leszeks): Make the verifier a bit more deserialization compatible.
899 void RegisterDeserializerStarted() { ++num_active_deserializers_; }
900 void RegisterDeserializerFinished() {
901 CHECK_GE(--num_active_deserializers_, 0);
902 }
903 bool has_active_deserializer() const {
904 return num_active_deserializers_.load(std::memory_order_acquire) > 0;
905 }
906#else
907 void RegisterDeserializerStarted() {}
908 void RegisterDeserializerFinished() {}
909 bool has_active_deserializer() const { UNREACHABLE(); }
910#endif

1040 // Re-throw an exception. This involves no error reporting since error

1043 // has to be set separately or be guaranteed to not have changed.

1051 // Tries to predict whether an exception will be caught. Note that this can
1052 // only produce an estimate, because it is undecidable whether a finally
1053 // clause will consume or re-throw an exception.
1054 enum CatchType {
1055 NOT_CAUGHT,
1056 CAUGHT_BY_JAVASCRIPT,
1057 CAUGHT_BY_EXTERNAL,
1058 CAUGHT_BY_PROMISE,
1059 CAUGHT_BY_ASYNC_AWAIT,
1060 };

1118 // Accessors.
1119#define GLOBAL_ACCESSOR(type, name, initialvalue) \
1120 inline type name() const { \
1121 DCHECK(OFFSET_OF(Isolate, name##_) == name##_debug_offset_); \
1122 return name##_; \
1123 } \
1124 inline void set_##name(type value) { \
1125 DCHECK(OFFSET_OF(Isolate, name##_) == name##_debug_offset_); \
1126 name##_ = value; \
1127 }
1128 ISOLATE_INIT_LIST(GLOBAL_ACCESSOR)
1129#undef GLOBAL_ACCESSOR
1130
1131 void SetDetailedSourcePositionsForProfiling(bool value) {
1132 if (value) {
1133 CollectSourcePositionsForAllBytecodeArrays();
1134 }
1135 detailed_source_positions_for_profiling_ = value;
1136 }
1137
1138 bool detailed_source_positions_for_profiling() const {
1139 return detailed_source_positions_for_profiling_;
1140 }
1141
1142#define GLOBAL_ARRAY_ACCESSOR(type, name, length) \
1143 inline type* name() { \
1144 DCHECK(OFFSET_OF(Isolate, name##_) == name##_debug_offset_); \
1145 return &(name##_)[0]; \
1146 }
1147 ISOLATE_INIT_ARRAY_LIST(GLOBAL_ARRAY_ACCESSOR)
1148#undef GLOBAL_ARRAY_ACCESSOR
1149
1150#define NATIVE_CONTEXT_FIELD_ACCESSOR(index, type, name) \
1151 inline Handle<type> name(); \
1152 inline bool is_##name(Tagged<type> value);
1153 NATIVE_CONTEXT_FIELDS(NATIVE_CONTEXT_FIELD_ACCESSOR)
1154#undef NATIVE_CONTEXT_FIELD_ACCESSOR

1188 // When pointer compression is on, this is the base address of the pointer
1189 // compression cage, and the kPtrComprCageBaseRegister is set to this
1190 // value. When pointer compression is off, this is always kNullAddress.
1191 Address cage_base() const {
1192 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOL,
1193 isolate_data()->cage_base() == kNullAddress);
1194 return isolate_data()->cage_base();
1195 }
1196
1197 // When pointer compression and external code space are on, this is the base
1198 // address of the cage where the code space is allocated. Otherwise, it
1199 // defaults to cage_base().
1200 Address code_cage_base() const {
1201#ifdef V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
1202 return code_cage_base_;
1203#else
1204 return cage_base();
1205#endif // V8_EXTERNAL_CODE_SPACE
1206 }

1216 // Generated code can embed this address to get access to the isolate-specific
1217 // data (for example, roots, external references, builtins, etc.).
1218 // The kRootRegister is set to this value.
1219 Address isolate_root() const { return isolate_data()->isolate_root(); }
1220 constexpr static size_t isolate_root_bias() {
1221 return OFFSET_OF(Isolate, isolate_data_) + IsolateData::kIsolateRootBias;
1222 }
1223 static Isolate* FromRootAddress(Address isolate_root) {
1224 return reinterpret_cast<Isolate*>(isolate_root - isolate_root_bias());
1225 }
1226
1227 RootsTable& roots_table() { return isolate_data()->roots(); }
1228 const RootsTable& roots_table() const { return isolate_data()->roots(); }
1229
1230 // A sub-region of the Isolate object that has "predictable" layout which
1231 // depends only on the pointer size and therefore it's guaranteed that there
1232 // will be no compatibility issues because of different compilers used for
1233 // snapshot generator and actual V8 code.
1234 // Thus, kRootRegister may be used to address any location that falls into
1235 // this region.
1236 // See IsolateData::AssertPredictableLayout() for details.
1237 base::AddressRegion root_register_addressable_region() const {
1238 return base::AddressRegion(reinterpret_cast<Address>(&isolate_data_),
1239 sizeof(IsolateData));
1240 }

1246 Handle<Object> root_handle(RootIndex index) {
1247 return Handle<Object>(&roots_table()[index]);

1294 static uint32_t thread_in_wasm_flag_address_offset() {
1295 // For WebAssembly trap handlers there is a flag in thread-local storage
1296 // which indicates that the executing thread executes WebAssembly code. To
1297 // access this flag directly from generated code, we store a pointer to the
1298 // flag in ThreadLocalTop in thread_in_wasm_flag_address_. This function
1299 // here returns the offset of that member from {isolate_root()}.
1300 return static_cast<uint32_t>(
1301 OFFSET_OF(Isolate, isolate_data_) +
1302 OFFSET_OF(IsolateData, thread_local_top_) +
1303 OFFSET_OF(ThreadLocalTop, thread_in_wasm_flag_address_) -
1304 isolate_root_bias());
1305 }
1306
1307 constexpr static uint32_t context_offset() {
1308 return static_cast<uint32_t>(
1309 OFFSET_OF(Isolate, isolate_data_) +
1310 OFFSET_OF(IsolateData, thread_local_top_) +
1311 OFFSET_OF(ThreadLocalTop, context_) -
1312 isolate_root_bias());
1313 }
1314
1315 static uint32_t error_message_param_offset() {
1316 return static_cast<uint32_t>(OFFSET_OF(Isolate, isolate_data_) +
1317 OFFSET_OF(IsolateData, error_message_param_) -
1318 isolate_root_bias());
1319 }
1320
1321 uint8_t error_message_param() { return isolate_data_.error_message_param_; }

1393 std::vector<int>* regexp_indices() { return &regexp_indices_; }
1394
1395 Debug* debug() const { return debug_; }
1396
1397 bool is_profiling() const {
1398 return isolate_data_.execution_mode_ &
1399 IsolateExecutionModeFlag::kIsProfiling;
1400 }
1401
1402 void SetIsProfiling(bool enabled) {
1403 if (enabled) {
1404 CollectSourcePositionsForAllBytecodeArrays();
1405 RequestInvalidateNoProfilingProtector();
1406 }
1407 isolate_data_.execution_mode_.set(IsolateExecutionModeFlag::kIsProfiling,
1408 enabled);
1409 UpdateLogObjectRelocation();
1410 }
1411
1412 // Perform side effect checks on function calls and API callbacks.
1413 // See Debug::StartSideEffectCheckMode().
1414 bool should_check_side_effects() const {
1415 return isolate_data_.execution_mode_ &
1416 IsolateExecutionModeFlag::kCheckSideEffects;
1417 }
1418
1419 DebugInfo::ExecutionMode debug_execution_mode() const {
1420 return should_check_side_effects() ? DebugInfo::kSideEffects
1421 : DebugInfo::kBreakpoints;
1422 }
1423 void set_debug_execution_mode(DebugInfo::ExecutionMode debug_execution_mode) {
1424 bool check_side_effects = debug_execution_mode == DebugInfo::kSideEffects;
1425 isolate_data_.execution_mode_.set(
1426 IsolateExecutionModeFlag::kCheckSideEffects, check_side_effects);
1427 }

1432#ifdef DEBUG
1433 static size_t non_disposed_isolates() { return non_disposed_isolates_; }
1434
1435 // Turbofan's string builder optimization can introduce SlicedString that are
1436 // less than SlicedString::kMinLength characters. Their live range and scope
1437 // are pretty limitted, but they can be visible to the GC, which shouldn't
1438 // treat them as invalid. When such short SlicedString are introduced,
1439 // Turbofan will set has_turbofan_string_builders_ to true, which
1440 // SlicedString::SlicedStringVerify will check when verifying SlicedString to
1441 // decide if a too-short SlicedString is an issue or not.
1442 // See the compiler's StringBuilderOptimizer class for more details.
1443 bool has_turbofan_string_builders() { return has_turbofan_string_builders_; }
1444 void set_has_turbofan_string_builders() {
1445 has_turbofan_string_builders_ = true;
1446 }
1447#endif

1449 v8::internal::Factory* factory() {
1450 // Upcast to the privately inherited base-class using c-style casts to avoid
1451 // undefined behavior (as static_cast cannot cast across private bases).
1452 return (v8::internal::Factory*)this;
1453 }

1678 int NextOptimizationId() {

1685
1686 // https://github.com/tc39/proposal-top-level-await/pull/159
1687 // TODO(syg): Update to actual spec link once merged.
1688 //
1689 // According to the spec, modules that depend on async modules (i.e. modules
1690 // with top-level await) must be evaluated in order in which their
1691 // [[AsyncEvaluating]] flags were set to true. V8 tracks this global total
1692 // order with next_module_async_evaluating_ordinal_. Each module that sets its
1693 // [[AsyncEvaluating]] to true grabs the next ordinal.
1694 unsigned NextModuleAsyncEvaluatingOrdinal() {
1695 unsigned ordinal = next_module_async_evaluating_ordinal_++;
1696 CHECK_LT(ordinal, kMaxModuleAsyncEvaluatingOrdinal);
1697 return ordinal;
1698 }
1699
1700 inline void DidFinishModuleAsyncEvaluation(unsigned ordinal);

1706 FireCallCompletedCallbackInternal(microtask_queue);
1707 }

1971 void IsolateInBackgroundNotification();
1972
1973 bool is_backgrounded() { return is_backgrounded_; }
1974
1975 // When efficiency mode is enabled we can favor single core throughput without
1976 // latency requirements. Any decision based on this flag must be quickly
1977 // reversible as we have to expect to migrate out of efficiency mode on short
1978 // notice. E.g., it would not be advisable to generate worse code in
1979 // efficiency mode. The decision when to enable efficiency mode is steered by
1980 // the embedder. Currently the only signal (potentially) being considered is
1981 // if an isolate is in foreground or background mode.
1982 bool EfficiencyModeEnabled() {
1983 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.efficiency_mode.value().has_value())) {
1984 return *v8_flags.efficiency_mode.value();
1985 }
1986 return is_backgrounded();
1987 }
1988
1989 // This is a temporary api until we use it by default.
1990 bool EfficiencyModeEnabledForTiering() {
1991 return v8_flags.efficiency_mode_for_tiering_heuristics &&
1992 EfficiencyModeEnabled();
1993 }
1994
1995 // In battery saver mode we optimize to reduce total cpu cycles spent. Battery
1996 // saver mode is opt-in by the embedder. As with efficiency mode we must
1997 // expect that the mode is toggled off again and we should be able to ramp up
1998 // quickly after that.
1999 bool BatterySaverModeEnabled() {
2000 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.battery_saver_mode.value().has_value())) {
2001 return *v8_flags.battery_saver_mode.value();
2002 }
2003 return V8_UNLIKELY(battery_saver_mode_enabled_);
2004 }

2254 class ThreadDataTable {
2255 public:
2256 ThreadDataTable() = default;
2257
2258 PerIsolateThreadData* Lookup(ThreadId thread_id);
2259 void Insert(PerIsolateThreadData* data);
2260 void Remove(PerIsolateThreadData* data);
2261 void RemoveAllThreads();
2262
2263 private:
2264 struct Hasher {
2265 std::size_t operator()(const ThreadId& t) const {
2266 return std::hash<int>()(t.ToInteger());
2267 }
2268 };
2269
2270 std::unordered_map<ThreadId, PerIsolateThreadData*, Hasher> table_;
2271 };
2272
2273 // These items form a stack synchronously with threads Enter'ing and Exit'ing
2274 // the Isolate. The top of the stack points to a thread which is currently
2275 // running the Isolate. When the stack is empty, the Isolate is considered
2276 // not entered by any thread and can be Disposed.
2277 // If the same thread enters the Isolate more than once, the entry_count_
2278 // is incremented rather then a new item pushed to the stack.
2279 class EntryStackItem {
2280 public:
2281 EntryStackItem(PerIsolateThreadData* previous_thread_data,
2282 Isolate* previous_isolate, EntryStackItem* previous_item)
2283 : entry_count(1),
2284 previous_thread_data(previous_thread_data),
2285 previous_isolate(previous_isolate),
2286 previous_item(previous_item) {}
2287 EntryStackItem(const EntryStackItem&) = delete;
2288 EntryStackItem& operator=(const EntryStackItem&) = delete;
2289
2290 int entry_count;
2291 PerIsolateThreadData* previous_thread_data;
2292 Isolate* previous_isolate;
2293 EntryStackItem* previous_item;
2294 };
2295
2296 static Isolate* process_wide_shared_space_isolate_;

2301 PerIsolateThreadData* data);

2425 // Helper function for RunHostImportModuleDynamicallyCallback.

2427 // import() and returns them in a FixedArray, sorted by code point order of
2428 // the keys, in the form [key1, value1, key2, value2, ...]. Returns an empty

2431 // reject the import() call's Promise.

2735// The current entered Isolate and its thread data. Do not access these
2736// directly! Use Isolate::Current and Isolate::CurrentPerIsolateThreadData.
2737//
2738// These are outside the Isolate class with extern storage because in clang-cl,
2739// thread_local is incompatible with dllexport linkage caused by
2740// V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE being applied to Isolate.
2741extern thread_local Isolate::PerIsolateThreadData*
2742 g_current_per_isolate_thread_data_ V8_CONSTINIT;
2743extern thread_local Isolate* g_current_isolate_ V8_CONSTINIT;

2749// SaveContext scopes save the current context on the Isolate on creation, and
2750// restore it on destruction.
2751class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE SaveContext {
2752 public:
2753 explicit SaveContext(Isolate* isolate);
2754
2755 ~SaveContext();
2756
2757 private:
2758 Isolate* const isolate_;
2759 Handle<Context> context_;
2760 Handle<Context> topmost_script_having_context_;
2761};
2762
2763// Like SaveContext, but also switches the Context to a new one in the
2764// constructor.
2765class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE SaveAndSwitchContext : public SaveContext {
2766 public:
2767 SaveAndSwitchContext(Isolate* isolate, Tagged<Context> new_context);
2768};
2769
2770// A scope which sets the given isolate's context to null for its lifetime to
2771// ensure that code does not make assumptions on a context being available.
2772class V8_NODISCARD NullContextScope : public SaveAndSwitchContext {
2773 public:
2774 explicit NullContextScope(Isolate* isolate)
2775 : SaveAndSwitchContext(isolate, Context()) {}
2776};
2777
2778class AssertNoContextChange {
2779#ifdef DEBUG
2780 public:
2781 explicit AssertNoContextChange(Isolate* isolate);
2782 ~AssertNoContextChange() {
2783 CHECK_EQ(isolate_->context(), *context_);
2784 // The caller context is either cleared or not modified.
2785 if (!isolate_->topmost_script_having_context().is_null()) {
2786 CHECK_EQ(isolate_->topmost_script_having_context(),
2787 *topmost_script_having_context_);
2788 }
2789 }
2790
2791 private:
2792 Isolate* isolate_;
2793 Handle<Context> context_;
2794 Handle<Context> topmost_script_having_context_;
2795#else
2796 public:
2797 explicit AssertNoContextChange(Isolate* isolate) {}
2798#endif
2799};
2800
2801class ExecutionAccess {
2802 public:
2803 explicit ExecutionAccess(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {
2804 Lock(isolate);
2805 }
2806 ~ExecutionAccess() { Unlock(isolate_); }
2807
2808 static void Lock(Isolate* isolate) { isolate->break_access()->Lock(); }
2809 static void Unlock(Isolate* isolate) { isolate->break_access()->Unlock(); }
2810
2811 static bool TryLock(Isolate* isolate) {
2812 return isolate->break_access()->TryLock();
2813 }
2814
2815 private:
2816 Isolate* isolate_;
2817};
2818
2819// Support for checking for stack-overflows.
2820class StackLimitCheck {
2821 public:
2822 explicit StackLimitCheck(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {}
2823
2824 // Use this to check for stack-overflows in C++ code.
2825 bool HasOverflowed() const {
2826 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate_->stack_guard();
2827 return GetCurrentStackPosition() < stack_guard->real_climit();
2828 }
2829 static bool HasOverflowed(LocalIsolate* local_isolate);
2830
2831 // Use this to check for stack-overflow when entering runtime from JS code.
2832 bool JsHasOverflowed(uintptr_t gap = 0) const;
2833
2834 // Use this to check for stack-overflow when entering runtime from Wasm code.
2835 // If it is called from the central stack, while a switch was performed,
2836 // it checks logical stack limit of a secondary stack stored in the isolate,
2837 // instead checking actual one.
2838 bool WasmHasOverflowed(uintptr_t gap = 0) const;
2839
2840 // Use this to check for interrupt request in C++ code.
2841 V8_INLINE bool InterruptRequested() {
2842 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate_->stack_guard();
2843 return GetCurrentStackPosition() < stack_guard->climit();
2844 }
2845
2846 // Precondition: InterruptRequested == true.
2847 // Returns true if any interrupt (overflow or termination) was handled, in
2848 // which case the caller must prevent further JS execution.
2849 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool HandleStackOverflowAndTerminationRequest();
2850
2851 private:
2852 Isolate* const isolate_;
2853};
2854
2855// This macro may be used in context that disallows JS execution.
2856// That is why it checks only for a stack overflow and termination.
2857#define STACK_CHECK(isolate, result_value) \
2858 do { \
2859 StackLimitCheck stack_check(isolate); \
2860 if (V8_UNLIKELY(stack_check.InterruptRequested()) && \
2861 V8_UNLIKELY(stack_check.HandleStackOverflowAndTerminationRequest())) { \
2862 return result_value; \
2863 } \
2864 } while (false)
2865
2866class StackTraceFailureMessage {
2867 public:
2868 enum StackTraceMode { kIncludeStackTrace, kDontIncludeStackTrace };
2869
2870 explicit StackTraceFailureMessage(Isolate* isolate, StackTraceMode mode,
2871 void* ptr1 = nullptr, void* ptr2 = nullptr,
2872 void* ptr3 = nullptr, void* ptr4 = nullptr,
2873 void* ptr5 = nullptr, void* ptr6 = nullptr);
2874
2875 V8_NOINLINE void Print() volatile;
2876
2877 static const uintptr_t kStartMarker = 0xdecade30;
2878 static const uintptr_t kEndMarker = 0xdecade31;
2879 static const int kStacktraceBufferSize = 32 * KB;
2880
2881 uintptr_t start_marker_ = kStartMarker;
2882 void* isolate_;
2883 void* ptr1_;
2884 void* ptr2_;
2885 void* ptr3_;
2886 void* ptr4_;
2887 void* ptr5_;
2888 void* ptr6_;
2889 void* code_objects_[4];
2890 char js_stack_trace_[kStacktraceBufferSize];
2891 uintptr_t end_marker_ = kEndMarker;
2892};

2894template <base::MutexSharedType kIsShared>
2895class V8_NODISCARD SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread<Isolate, kIsShared> final {
2896 public:
2897 SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread(base::SharedMutex* mutex, Isolate* isolate) {
2898 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(mutex);
2899 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(isolate);
2900 DCHECK_EQ(ThreadId::Current(), isolate->thread_id());
2901 }
2902
2903 SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread(const SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread&) = delete;
2904 SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread& operator=(const SharedMutexGuardIfOffThread&) =
2905 delete;
2906};
